snippet: The apparent stand-down in the strait appeared to reflect efforts by both sides not to allow any show of military bravado to hurt the nuclear talks
abstract: Iran and United States both recede from potential conflict in Strait of Hormuz following impounding of cargo vessel from Marshall Islands by Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corp; dissipation of tension is seen by many as reflection of efforts by both nations to avoid impacting multinational nuclear talks.
lead_paragraph: The apparent stand-down in the strait appeared to reflect efforts by both sides not to allow any show of military bravado to hurt the nuclear talks

headline.main: U.S.-Iran Tensions Appear to Ease in Strait of Hormuz
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Iran Tensions Appear to Ease After Ship Seizure in Strait of Hormuz
